Violation_Type: Failure to assess adequacy of state protection
Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in rejecting the claim by failing to consider the totality of evidence on state protection
Application_Facts: Applicants claimed refugee status due to persecution in Hungary
Decision_Outcome: Board rejected the refugee claim based on state protection
Defendant_Behavior: Board focused on 'serious efforts' rather than adequacy of protection
Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, subsection 72(1)
Evidence_Used: Evidence regarding state protection in Hungary
Legal_Provision_Cited: Subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Basis: Refugee protection due to fear of persecution
Evidence_Assessed: Totality of evidence on state protection
Governing_Rule: The Board must assess adequacy, not just 'serious efforts'
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to properly assess adequacy of protection
Outcome: Decision set aside; matter referred to a different panel
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution in country of origin
Cause_Description: Board applied incorrect legal test focusing on 'serious efforts' instead of adequacy of protection
Evidence_Handling: Incomplete consideration of evidence on state protection
Legal_Provision_Violated: Principles of reasonableness in decision-making under IRPA
Evidence_Issues: Ambiguity in conclusion mixing adequacy and effort
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient assessment of state protection adequacy
Decision_Rationale: Reliance on 'serious efforts' test instead of adequacy rendered decision unreasonable
Evidentiary_Issues: Ambiguous conclusion combining adequacy and effort
